channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: グーグル、メタ、Xのような企業がジャーナリズムの信頼できる増幅と支援から手を引く中、ニュース出版社はウェブトラフィックの減少と格闘している（ニューヨーク・タイムズ）。
item.description:
New York Times:
News publishers wrestle with declines in web traffic as companies like Google, Meta, and X back away from dependably amplifying and supporting journalism  —  News organizations are scrambling to adjust to the latest rift in the long-fractious relationship between publishers and tech platforms.

item.title: ジョン・スチュワート氏のApple TV+番組、2シーズンで終了：スチュワート氏は、中国とAIの話題がアップル幹部を悩ませたと語った（New York Times）．
item.description:
New York Times:
Jon Stewart's Apple TV+ show ends after two seasons, sources say over creative differences; source: Stewart said China and AI topics concerned Apple executives  —  Mr. Stewart and Apple are parting ways because of creative differences over “The Problem,” people with knowledge of the decision said.

item.title: テレグラフ・メディア・グループ副編集長キャサリン・ベントリー＝グールドストーンに、新聞の「デジタルデフォルト」アプローチ、解約への対応などについてインタビュー（Bron Maher/Press Gazette）。
item.description:
Bron Maher / Press Gazette:
An interview with Telegraph Media Group Deputy Editor Catherine Bentley-Gouldstone on the newspaper's “digital-default” approach, dealing with churn, and more  —  “If we produce something that's the same as everybody else's - why are they going to pay for it?"

item.title: ソースXは10月17日、ニューヨーク・タイムズのメインアカウントの "verified "バッジを予告なく削除：NYTへのXのトラフィックは2023年8月以来〜50％減少（Drew Harwell/Washington Post）
item.description:
Drew Harwell / Washington Post:
Source: X removed the main New York Times account's “verified” badge on October 17 without notice; source: X traffic to the NYT is down ~50% since August 2023  —  The unexplained decision removes the only symbol distinguishing the news organization from impostors and comes amid …

item.title: 情報筋Apple、「The Line」や「Run, Bambi, Run」などApple TVチームが企画したものを含め、自社が所有・運営するポッドキャストへの広告掲載を検討（Ashley Carman/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Ashley Carman / Bloomberg:
Sources: Apple considers selling ads on podcasts the company owns and operates, including those the Apple TV team greenlit, such as The Line and Run, Bambi, Run  —  Terms of ServiceDo Not Sell or Share My Personal Information Trademarks Privacy Policy©2023 Bloomberg L.P. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: 情報筋ジョージ・クルーニー率いるAリスト俳優がSAG-AFTRAに会費の上限撤廃を提案するも、SAG-AFTRAの交渉委員会は「妥当性を認めなかった」（Variety紙）
item.description:
Variety:
Sources: A-list actors led by George Clooney proposed that SAG-AFTRA remove the cap on dues, but SAG-AFTRA's negotiating committee “didn't see the validity”  —  A group of A-list actors led by George Clooney presented a proposal to SAG-AFTRA leadership during a Tuesday afternoon Zoom call …

item.title: BBCニュースナイトの司会者カースティ・ワークは、次の選挙後に降板する予定。
item.description:
Kirsty Wark / BBC:
BBC Newsnight lead presenter Kirsty Wark plans to step down after the next UK election; Wark is the show's longest-serving presenter, having joined in 1993  —  Kirsty will continue to present for the BBC on programmes including The Reunion, Start the Week on Radio 4, as well as documentaries

item.title: BBCは、同局の悲劇報道をめぐって内部で動揺が広がるなか、ガザの病院で起きた爆発の背後にイスラエルが関与していると「推測したのは誤りだった」と述べた（Jake Kanter/Deadline）
item.description:
Jake Kanter / Deadline:
The BBC says the broadcaster was “wrong to speculate” that Israel was behind the blast at a Gaza hospital amid internal unrest over its coverage of the tragedy  —  EXCLUSIVE: The BBC has said it was “wrong to speculate” on who was responsible for the devastating blast …

item.title: FCC、ネット中立性ルールの再確立に向けた意見募集を3対2で可決、より広範な取り組みはまだ長い法的・政治的戦いに直面している（Devin Coldewey/TechCrunch）
item.description:
Devin Coldewey / TechCrunch:
The FCC votes 3-2 to invite the US public to comment on re-establishing net neutrality rules; the broader effort still faces a long legal and political battle  —  The Federal Communications Commission officially began its effort to re-establish net neutrality at its monthly meeting today …

item.title: イスラエル、「国家安全保障や公の秩序を害する、あるいは『敵のプロパガンダ』の根拠となる」放送局の放送を当局が停止できる新ルールを承認（Laura Wagner/Washington Post紙）
item.description:
Laura Wagner / Washington Post:
Israel approves new rules that let officials halt broadcasts of outlets that “harm national security, public order, or serve as a basis for ‘enemy propaganda’”  —  Israel approved new emergency regulations Wednesday that could pave the way for censoring Al Jazeera …

item.title: 分析：ウェストミンスターにアクセスできる英国の政治ジャーナリスト約12人が、政治団体、法律事務所、ロビー団体などからの支払いを申告していた（ジム・エドワーズ／プレス・ガゼット紙）
item.description:
Jim Edwards / Press Gazette:
Analysis: around 12 UK political journalists with access to Westminster have declared payments from political organizations, law firms, lobby groups, and others  —  Some 76 Lobby journalists declare financial interests.  —  Of the 437 political journalists with passes that give them access …

item.title: ヒプグノシス、投資信託の継続を承認する投票を前に、創業者メルク・マーキュリアディスの更迭につながる可能性のある「戦略的見直し」を開始（Mark Sweney/The Guardian）
item.description:
Mark Sweney / The Guardian:
Hipgnosis launches a “strategic review” that could lead to the ousting of founder Merck Mercuriadis ahead of a vote to approve continuing the investment trust  —  Merck Mercuriadis promised to turn songs into gold on launching Hipgnosis.  Now, a review could see him ousted

item.title: ガザで起きた病院の爆発事故に関するメディアの報道の移り変わりは、現地にいるジャーナリストが少ない中で、急速に進行する戦争を報道することの難しさを浮き彫りにしている（Katie Robertson/New York Times）。
item.description:
Katie Robertson / New York Times:
Shifting media coverage of a deadly hospital explosion in Gaza highlights the difficulties of reporting on a fast-moving war with few journalists on the ground  —  The fast-moving events highlighted the difficulty of covering the war between Israel and Hamas.

item.title: マイク・ハッカビー、ライサ・ターカースト、その他の著者が、海賊版書籍を含むBooks3データセットをLLMの訓練に使用したことをめぐり、メタ、マイクロソフト、ブルームバーグを提訴（Blake Brittain/Reuters）
item.description:
Blake Brittain / Reuters:
Mike Huckabee, Lysa TerKeurst, and other authors sue Meta, Microsoft, and Bloomberg over using the Books3 dataset, which contains pirated books, to train LLMs  —  A group of writers including former Arkansas governor Mike Huckabee and best-selling Christian author Lysa TerKeurst have filed …

item.title: 10月6日から9日にかけてアメリカの成人1,003人を対象に行われた世論調査：34％がSAG-AFTRAのストライキに参加する俳優側につき、7％がスタジオ側につき、29％が同等に同情し、30％がノー・ポジション（Christi Carras/Los Angeles Times）
item.description:
Christi Carras / Los Angeles Times:
An October 6 to 9 poll of 1,003 US adults: 34% side with the actors in SAG-AFTRA's strike, 7% back the studios, 29% sympathize equally, and 30% took no position  —  As the Hollywood writers' strike has come to a close and the actors' walkout rages on, the American public continues to favor unions …
